subject: Re: correspondence in Quikscript
msgSnippet: I just got started (as in, yesterday) learning Quikscript. I started out learning various types of shorthand, but I wanted something that was not only quick
messageBody:
I just got started (as in, yesterday) learning Quikscript. I started out learning various types of shorthand, but I wanted something that was not only quick and easy to write but also accurate enough that I could go back and read it a week later with no issues. Hopefully this alphabet will do the trick!

Anyway, I think that you have the right idea. Once I memorize the alphabet better, maybe we can just start posting messages in QS and see if anyone responds? :)

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Robert Jack Will <willitheowl@...> wrote:
>
> Hello everybody,
> Since I learned Quikscript a couple of weeks ago, I am using it for my
> shopping lists, paper journal, and other notes on paper and a little
> bit on the computer. But most of my English writing is still in Latin
> letters, because most of my writing is communication with other
> people! I find it especially sad to write in Latin letters even when I
> write to other people who like Quikscript!
> I would love to use Quikscript for communication with people instead
> of just writing to myself. Would anybody here be interested in having
> a written-in-Quikscript mailing list or newsletter or IRC channel? I
> think this would be something really interesting, fun, and helpful for
> the movement in general. I think there would be lots of things we
> could talk about while writing in QS. And we would use the orthography
> in practice, see how things look, how things feel, how easy it is for
> international speakers to understand each other.
> cheers,
> Jack
>
